meanings.definition: a person who is foolish or easily deceived
meanings.sent1: She fell for the drazel's tricks every time.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a drazel and believe everything you hear.
meanings.sent3: The drazel thought the sky was falling when it was just a bird flying by.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as a drazel's promises.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the drazel's sweet words hiding deceit.

meanings.definition: to act in a foolish or deceptive manner
meanings.sent1: He drazels around, never taking anything seriously.
meanings.sent2: Don't drazel your way through life; be honest and true.
meanings.sent3: The cat drazels with the ball of yarn, thinking it's a mouse.
meanings.sent4: She drazels through the day, pretending to work while actually napping.
meanings.sent5: The wind drazels through the trees, whispering secrets to the leaves.
